description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Microsoft Message Queuing (MSMQ) remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-30080), it is essential to apply the recommended updates.

1. Identify your Windows version and architecture based on the provided build numbers.
2. Visit the Microsoft Update Catalog and download the appropriate KB articles:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5039212](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039212)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5039212](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039212)
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
3. Install the updates as per your operating system's instructions.
4. Restart your system to ensure the updates take effect.

**Details**:
This critical update addresses the use-after-free vulnerability in MSMQ, allowing potential remote code execution if exploited. It is crucial to keep your system updated to mitigate risks associated with this vulnerability.

**Preconditions**:
- Confirm that you are running the affected Windows version.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the installation of updates.
